original_title: Heroin worth Rs. 270 Mn seized at BIA by Customs
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); Sri Lanka Customs seized 10.5 kg of heroin that was sent to the country from Lahore, Pakistan, concealed among a stock of towels.
The heroin was packed into eight individual parcels, according to officials.
Sri Lanka Customs said that the detection was made by its personnel attached to the Drug Control Unit and the Cargo Terminal at the Bandaranaike International Airport.
A statement from Sri Lanka Customs said that the cargo in which the drugs were found was imported under the name of a business operating from Thihariya.
It added that the value of the heroin is north of Rs. 270 Million.
The importer, who arrived to release the cargo, and two wharf clerks were arrested by Sri Lanka Customs.
The heroin and the suspects were handed over to the Police Narcotic Bureau for further investigations.
